{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3568153,"name":"Rishab Tirupathi","username":"rishabtirupathi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/9d8465/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T16:54:06.788Z","cooked":"

In order to speed up the WPILib process, I am thinking of making a server to automatically upload and load .class files when Java source files are written to. I was inspired by the Vite development server for JavaScript applications, which does a similar thing. I know that WPILib uses SSH to deploy (copy) the compiled Java files to the RoboRIO, so I am thinking of maintaining a continuous SSH connection between the computer and RoboRIO in order to speed up the server. I thought that although deploying through Ethernet or USB is very fast, doing so wirelessly is slower, so this could speed it up.

My question is: Is this a good idea? It seems like it would speed up development, but I can’t help thinking that it is unsafe in some way. I feel like it could damage something, especially if the code is reloaded when the robot is moving. Although I might be able to find a way to not compile until the robot is disabled, I still don’t know if this server could damage the robot in any other way.

My other question is: Would anyone actually benefit from this? I feel like people might, but I am genuinely not sure how much this server would speed up the development process.

The turnaround on deploying code is so fast these days that I can’t see the benefit.

If you really need faster iteration than the deploy script allows, constants files can be updated instantly and require only a robot reboot - or, you can databind to dashboard widgets over NT, which doesn’t even require a reboot.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T17:03:27.963Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":48.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496874,"topic_slug":"trying-to-create-a-development-server-for-wpilib-java-any-advice","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/trying-to-create-a-development-server-for-wpilib-java-any-advice/496874/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3568169,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T17:06:13.270Z","cooked":"

We actually deploy the Jar file to the robot, not the individual class files. So you could deploy the Jar, but that’d be no quicker then just doing a deploy.

When you don’t change native libraries, the deploy should be extremely fast. Most jars are probably a few MB at most. Most of the time is actually spent doing up to date checks for the libraries, and stopping/starting the robot process.

What is “databinding to dashboard widgets” over NetworkTables?

Having your code read from and respond to widgets/inputs on a dashboard.

For example, if you want to tune PID, you might have P, I, and D inputs added to your dashboard-du-jour, and have code on the robot that reads the values and reconfigures the PidController object (or PID configuration in the related motor controller, or or or…)
